title: Adam Shagash's Adyghe to English Dictionary (2020)

-1о:
-1о

Type: suffix

Definitions:

1.
slightly too much; (more common in adjectives) a suffix that designates slight excessiveness, meaning, the condition of slightly going or slightly being beyond what is needed, desired, or appropriate.
-адж:
-адж

Type: suffix

Definitions:

1.
bad; horrible
2.
dis- (Used as an intensifier of words with negative valence.)
-гъах:
-гъах

Type: suffix

Definitions:

1.
(added to verbs) a verbal suffix that designates absolute accomplishment/realization of the action
Л1ыр лажьэу егупшысагъ лэжьэгъахэмэ сыд ыш1эщтыр — The man while working thought what he will do after he done working.
Л1ым лэжьэгъах — The man done working.
Седжэгъах — I done studying.
Экзаменым сыфеджэгъах — I done studying for the exam.
Сэ седжэгъахэп — I still have not done studying.
2.
(added to verbs) a verbal suffix that designates that the action was already done
Л1ым лэжьэгъах — The man while working thought what he will do after he done working.
К1алэм тызеджагъэр пшъашъэм ри1отэгъах — The boy already told the girl what we studied.
К1алэм хъугъэр ылъэгъугъах — The boy already saw what happened.
К1алэм тыгъэпсыгъэр ес1отэгъах — I already told the boy what we planned.
Сэ сышхэгъах — I already ate.
Сэ сышхэгъахэти мэлак1э сыл1эжьырэп — Because I ate already, I am no longer hungry.
-гъу:
-гъу

Type: suffix

Definitions:

1.
time; time of
2.
a person in the same kind/group, a person that the same feature or attribute
-дж:
-дж

Type: suffix

Definitions:

1.
bad; horrible
2.
dis- (Used as an intensifier of words with negative valence.)
-жъ:
-жъ

Type: suffix

Definitions:

1.
(added to nouns) freaking, bloody (intensifier), damn
2.
(added to nouns) old
3.

-жьы:
-жьы

Type: prefix

Definitions:

1.
(added to verbs) a verbal suffix that designates recurrence/repetition of the verb. It can also be used to indicate an action that someone was doing before and now continuing it
2.
(added to verbs) a verbal suffix that designates finishing/completing the verb.
-зэ:
-зэ

Type: suffix

Definitions:

1.
(added to verbs) a verbal suffix that is used to introduce a clause or sentence which follows on in time from the first, unlike the suffix -и there is no emphasize that the second sentence happened due to the first one, rather, the emphasize is more of the time sequence
К1алэр тучаным к1озэ щэ ыщэфыгъ — The boy went to the store and bought milk.
Л1ым к1орахъок1э сеозэ л1эу ыблагъ — I shot the man with a gun and he started to die.
Синыбджэгъухэмэ са1ук1эзэ къэбар къэт1уатэу тыублагъ — I met with my friends and we started to chat.
Экзаменым сыфеджэзэ экзаменыр дэгъоу сыш1ыгъ — I studied for the exam and I did it good.
Бэрэ сылэжьэзэ сышхэнэу сык1уагъ — I worked a lot and went to eat.
-зэпыт:
-зэпыт

Type: adv

Definitions:

1.
always; all the time
К1алэр губжызэпыт — The boy always gets angry.
Учъыезэпытыщта? — Will you always sleep?
Л1ыр лэжьэзэпыт, зигъэпсэфырэп — The man always work, he doesn't rest.
Тылэжьэзэпыт, нек1о зы тхьэмафэ горэм зыдгъэпсэфыщт — We always work, let's rest for some one week.
1офымк1э машинэхэр лэжьэзэпытых — In work, the machines are always working.
Л1ым чэщым чылэр къек1ухьэзэпыт — The man always goes around the village in the night.
-и:
-и

Type: suffix

Definitions:

1.
(added to verbs) a verbal suffix that is used to introduce a clause or sentence which follows on in consequence from the first, meaning there is an emphasize that the second sentence happened because of the first and they are directly related
К1алэр ч1ыгум тефи ылъакъо у1агъэ — The boy fell on the ground and his leg got wounded.
Л1ым к1орахъок1э сеуи сыук1ыгъ — I shot the man with a gun and killed him.
Унэм маш1о хани стэу ыблагъ — The house caught on fire and it started to burn.
К1алэм зыгорэ ес1уи джэуап къыситыжьыгъ — I told someting to the boy and he gave me a response.
-к1о:
-к1о

Type: suffix

Definitions:

1.
(added to verbs) A person that does an action indicated by the root verb; used to form an agent noun.
-к1э:
-к1э

Type: suffix

Cognates:

shapsug: -гьэ

Definitions:

1.
(added to nouns) the instrumental case (a grammatical case used to indicate that a noun is the instrument or means by or with which the subject achieves or accomplishes an action)
К1алэр къэлэмк1э матхэ — The boy is writing with a pencil
Л1ыр нэрыплъымк1э маплъэ — The man is looking with the binocular.
Сц1эк1э къысэджагъ ар — (S)he called me by my name.
Гъогумк1э сык1уагъ — I went via the road.
Гъогумк1э сык1уагъ — I went via the road.
К1эрахъок1э бланэм сеуагъ — I shot the deer with a gun.
Пшъашъэр гъунджэмк1э зэплъыжьыгъ — The girl looked at herself with the mirror
Л1ым уатэк1э ымыш1ахэу зэожьыгъ — The man hit himself with a hammer by mistake.
2.
(added to nouns) the directional case (a grammatical case used to indicate a direction)
Жьыбгъэр хымк1э къак1о — The wind is coming from the sea
Мык1э сыкъэк1уагъ — I came from here.
3.
(added to verrbs) a verbal suffix which is appended to verbs to form nouns meaning: the manner in which someone did the action
К1он - ик1уак1э — (S)he goes - the way (s)he goes.
Тхэн - итхак1э — (S)he writes - the way (s)he writes.
Угущы1ак1э сик1асэп, ухъонэзэпыт — I don't like how you speak, you always swear.
Л1ым игущы1ак1э 1эш1эхэу къыбгуры1онэу щыт — The way the man speaks is easy to understand.
Адыгабзэк1э еджак1э сыш1эрэп — I do not know how to speak Circassian.
Ку фык1э сыш1эрэп — I do not know how to drive a car.
Тхак1э сэш1ы — I know how to write.
Уитхак1э дахэ — The way you write is beautiful.
-ми:
-ми

Type: suffix

Definitions:

1.
(added to any word) if (conditional mood)
Бэ сышхыми мэлак1э сэл1э — Even if I eat a lot, I am hungry.

Сц1э къап1оми уц1э къэс1ожьыщтэп — Even if you say my name, I will not say yours.

Бэрэ уеджэми экзаменыр къыпфэш1ыщтэп — Even if you study a lot you could not do the exam.
Бэрэ уемыджэми экзаменыр къыпфэш1ыщт — Even if you will not study a lot you could do the exam.

-мэ

Type: suffix

Definitions:

Type: suffix

-нэс:
-нэс

Type: suffix

Definitions:

Сышхэнэс сыкъыдэк1ыщтэп — I will not go out until I eat.

Къалэм тынэсынэс орэд горэм тегъэдэ1у — Until we reach he city let us hear some song.

-хы

Type: suffix

-шъу:
-шъу

Type: suffix

Definitions:

1.
(added to verbs) designates the ability to perform the indicated action.
Сэ псынк1эу сэчъэшъу — I can run fast.

Сэ сизакъоу седжэшъущтэп — I can not study alone.
2.
(added to verbs) designates the possibility to perform the indicated action.
Непэ къещхышъущт — Today it can rain.

Усымаджэм ул1эшъущтыгъ — When you were sick you could have died.
3.
(added to verbs) designates the successfulness of performing the indicated action.
Америкэм тынэсышъущт — We can reach America.
Лъакъок1э Америкэм тынэсышъущтэп — We can not reach America by foot.
Экзаменым шъэ къипхышъущт — You can score hundred in the exam.
